mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-15, northwest wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Jenny [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reference to film Snakes on a Plane. Quotes attributed to Mark Twain and Oscar Wilde. Comparison of philosophers/mathematicians Kurt Friedrich Gödel and Bertrand Russell. One graffiti, half erased, expresses how tiresome it is living in uncertainty; another responds that life is tiring. Expression of pain and despair. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]

Snakes + Plane = Snakes on a Plane | Gödel > Russell | "there is no essential incongruity between crime and culture" - Oscar Wilde | "Never put off til tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow." - Mark Twain | Not knowing things can be very tiresome. | life is tiring | What will make the pain go away?
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mathematics
